page.title: 04FARM IRRIGATION.
page.content: One of the biggest headaches for the farmer is the weather; rainfall, or the lack of it. Lower Mount Farm has a licence to abstract water from the land for irrigation purposes. The water is obtained from a bore hole to the north-west of the farm buildings, and is bought to the surface by an electric pump. Hose reel irrigation machines are then used to irrigate the soft fruits and potatoes. The farmland also carries water pipes, which run from a pumping station to the reservoir, which in turn supplies the surrounding residential area with water. These pipes are covered by mounds of earth, as the surrounding land has been lowered due to gravel extraction.
